intro: Lappula badachschanica, commonly known as the Badakhshan flax, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its annual growth habit. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
